info.jonclark.treegraft.chartparser
Class Chart<R extends GrammarRule<T>,T extends Token>

java.lang.Object
  info.jonclark.treegraft.chartparser.Chart<R,T>
Type Parameters:
R - The rule type being used in this ChartParser
T - The token type being used in this ChartParser
public class Chart<R extends GrammarRule<T>,T extends Token>
extends java.lang.Object

A packed forest of Keys that represent the search space of valid parses (and partial parses) for the input sequence that generated the Chart.

Author:
Jonathan Clark

Field Summary
static int DEFAULT_CHART_SIZE
          The initial number of keys that space should be allocated for.

Chart()

DEFAULT_CHART_SIZE

public static final int DEFAULT_CHART_SIZE
The initial number of keys that space should be allocated for.

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Chart

public Chart()
Method Detail

addKey

public void addKey(Key<R,T> key)
Adds a Key to this Chart after it has been removed from the Agenda and its implications have been processed. This method should typically only be called by the ChartParser.

Parameters:
key - the key to be added

addParse

public void addParse(Key<R,T> key)
Adds a Key (that has already been added to this Chart using addKey()) when it represents a complete parse. This method should typically only be called by the ChartParser.

Parameters:
key - the key that represents a complete parse

isInputGrammatical

public boolean isInputGrammatical()
Check if the input is grammatical according to the given Grammar.

Returns:
True if one or more complete parses was found; false otherwise.

getKeys

public java.util.List<Key<R,T>> getKeys()
Gets the set of all Keys that are contained in this Chart in the order in which they were added.

Returns:
a set of keys

getGrammaticalParses

public Parse<R,T>[] getGrammaticalParses(ParseFormatter<R,T> formatter)
Gets the parses from this Chart that are grammatical according to the Grammar. These format of these parses (including whether a source tree, target tree, or target string is produced) is determined by the ParseFormatter.

Parameters:
formatter - the ParseFormatter that will determine the format of the returned parses
Returns:
an array of formatted grammatical parses

getParseForest

public <F> F getParseForest(ParseForestFormatter<R,T,F> formatter)
Get the parse forest (hypergraph) contained in this Chart including both grammatical and ungrammatical parses.

Type Parameters:
F - The type of the parse Forest that will be returned
Parameters:
formatter - a ParseForestFormatter that will determine how the returned parse forest is constructed including whether it is a source-side or target-side forest.
Returns:
A parse forest derived from this Chart.
